UEBS MBA Scholarship Description

  • Organization: University of Edinburgh Business School (UEBS)
  • Department: NA
  • Course level: Masters
  • Award Amount: £2,500–£5,000
  • Number of Awards: Several
  • Access Mode: Online
  • Nationality: All Countries
  • Eligible Countries: All international students are eligible to apply.
  • Eligibility: Students can apply for the MBA program offered at the University of Edinburgh Business School (UEBS).
  • Application Deadline: October 19, 2024

Eligibility Criteria For UEBS MBA Scholarship

 

You can only apply for a scholarship once you have received an offer (conditional or unconditional) to join one of the eligible programs and have either firmly accepted the offer or intend to do so. The scholarship selection panel can only consider your application if you hold an active offer throughout your application process (meaning if your offer is declined at any point up until the scholarship decision deadline, you will no longer be eligible). Eligible programs are:

  • Online MBA

You will not be eligible for this scholarship if:

  • Your employer fully sponsors you
  • You receive a full scholarship

If the applicant is successfully awarded a scholarship but subsequently declines their offer of admission to the Online MBA, the scholarship will be withdrawn and awarded to another applicant. An award will be withdrawn if a student fails to meet the conditions set by the University.

How to Apply For UEBS MBA Scholarship

Complete and submit a scholarship application form to apply for a scholarship. Be sure to do so soon after receiving an offer of admission to our MBA program. Our scholarship committee will review your application, and you will be notified of their decision regarding your eligibility for a scholarship. Please contact our office if you have any questions about the application process.

UEBS MBA Scholarship Benefits

The Business School will offer up to 10 Online UEBS MBA Diversity Scholarships, ranging between £2,500 and £5,000, to candidates who enhance the diversity of cultures or perspectives on the Edinburgh MBA.
